resources.description: The data as published by the DfT. Based on traffic counts in Herefordshire and modelling.
resources.name: Total traffic on major roads, in thousand vehicle miles, from 2000 to 2015

resources.description: This expresses the total number of miles estimated covered by each transport mode as a % of the total distance covered by all transport modes. It was calculated by the Bulmer Foundation based on DfT data
resources.name: % share of traffic between different types calculated from DfT data

resources.description: This was calculated by the Bulmer Foundation from DfT data. This is not a measure of the amount of cycling in the county (since it only covers major roads). However it is proposed as an indicator since, if people cycle more in the county this figure is likely to rise, if people cycle less this figure is likely to lessen.
resources.name: % distance covered on major roads by bicycle per year in Herefordshire

resources.description: This is not a measure of the use of public transport since it includes coaches, excludes trains, only covers major roads and measures miles covered without reference to occupancy. We are proposing to use it as an indicator because, if bus use increases this figure is likely to increase, if bus use decreases, this figure is likely to decrease
resources.name: % traffic from buses or coaches in herefordshire per year

organization.description:
This is the community datastore for Herefordshire. [Here is a post about what the datastore is and why you should care](http://h-map.org.uk/2016/05/06/what-is-the-herefordshire-datastore-and-why-should/).


Part of the [Brightspace Foundation Route Map project](http://h-map.org.uk/).

We blog over at the [Route Map blog](http://h-map.org.uk/category/all-posts/).

If you'd like to add data here, you'll need a datahub.io account. Then [contact the RouteMap project](http://h-map.org.uk/contact-us/).
organization.title: Herefordshire
organization.name: hdata

name: total-traffic-on-major-roads-in-herefordshire
notes: Data published by the Department for Transport which carry this warning. "Traffic figures at regional and national level are robust and are reported as National Statistics. However, this is not the case for road traffic at a local level. A note of this should be made when publishing these figures elsewhere and taken into account during any analyses."
title: Total traffic on major roads in Herefordshire
